description: Erection of a five storey office block with associated cycle storage, parking, landscaping and other works as a replacement for studio 5 and erection of an additional floor to studio 1 to create additional office space
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - No development other than demolition, site preparation and below ground works shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of each respective phase of development hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted therewith (Design & Access Statement received 27.01.17 and updated 28.02.17; Planning Statement, Drainage Strategy Report Drainage Assessment Form, Energy Statement, Outline Construction Environment Management Plan, Air Quality Assessment, Arboricultural Impact Assessment, BREEAM Land Use & Ecology Assessment, Biodiversity & Landscape Management Plan (Studio 1 & Studio 5), Daylight & Sunlight Report (dated 02.12.16) and Sustainability Statement received 27.01.17; Landscape Strategy received 27.01.17 (part-superseded by drawing no. 20.202 P2); Transport Statement Rev A received 23.03.17; Drawing no?s: 00.100, 10.201, 10.203-206, 10.253, 10.271-276, 20.171-174, 20.201, 20.203-204, 20.211-216, 20.253, 20.255-257, 20.273, 20.275-278, 20.281 and 20.291 (all version P1) received 27.01.17; 634-P1-002 (part-superseded by drawing no. 20.202 P2) received 27.01.17; 20.175 P2, 40.201-203 P2 and 40.204 P1 received 28.02.17; 634-P1-001 P02 (part-superseded by drawing no. 20.202 P2) received 28.02.17; 10.101 P2, 10.202 P2, 10.251-252 P2, 20.101 P3, 20.202 P2, 20.205-206 P2, 20.251-252 P2, 20.271-272 P2 and 20.274 P2 received 28.04.17) and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the buildings are occupied.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provision of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order), the new floor space of Studio 1 and Studio 5 hereby approved shall be used within the B1 use class only and for no other purpose (including any change of use to residential via the prior approval process).

Condition : 5 - Prior to the felling of any trees on site, full details of the proposed re-planting, and the proposed times of re-planting, shall be approved in writing by the local planning authority. All tree planting shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 6 - If within a period of ten years from the date of the planting of any tree pursuant to the requirements of condition 5, that tree, or any tree planted in replacement for it, is removed, uprooted or destroyed or dies (or becomes, in the opinion of the local planning authority, seriously damaged or defective), another tree of the same species and size as that originally planted shall be planted at the same place, unless the local planning authority gives its written consent to any variation.

Condition : 7 - The development hereby permitted shall only be operated in accordance with a Waste Management Strategy to be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority prior to the use of Studio 5 or the roof extension to Studio 1 hereby permitted.

Condition : 8 - Prior to the commencement of above ground works for Studio 5, the roof extension to Studio 1 or the amenity pavilion hereby permitted, full details (including manufacturers specifications) of the cycle parking facilities (for not less than 90 bicycles) for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall conform to current guidance such as the TfL London Cycling Design Standards in design and layout and be fully implemented and be made available for use before the first occupation of Studio 5 or the roof extension to Studio 1 hereby approved. Thereafter, the approved cycle spaces shall be retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 9 - (A). Prior to the commencement of above ground works for Studio 5, the roof extension to Studio 1 or the amenity pavilion hereby permitted, final detailed drainage designs (including drawings) and an associated detailed maintenance plan for each of the drainage feature components (including routine maintenance tasks and frequencies and the responsible body/bodies) shall been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority. The detailed designs must demonstrate that the runoff calculations to determine the attenuation required have taken the whole site into account and will restrict the runoff rate from the site to 203 l/s as per the ?Drainage Strategy Report Jan 2017?, ?Drainage Assessment Forms? and the email from Robert Mills to Tom Whitworth dated 24 March 2017.
(B). Prior to the first occupation/use of Studio 5, the roof extension to Studio 1 or the amenity pavilion hereby permitted, evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 11 - Prior to the commencement of the construction of Studio 5 or the amenity pavilion hereby permitted, a Delivery and Service Plan shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The Plan shall demonstrate clear vehicle swept paths. The development shall only be completed in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 12 - Prior to the commencement of the construction of Studio 5 or the amenity pavilion hereby permitted: 
a. A contaminated land Phase 1 desk study report shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. Should the Phase 1 report recommend that a Phase 2 site investigation is required, then this shall be carried out and submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The site shall be investigated by a competent person to identify the extent and nature of contamination. The report should include a tiered risk assessment of the contamination based on the proposed end use of the site. Additional investigation may be required where it is deemed necessary by the Local Planning Authority. 
b. A scheme for the decontamination of the site shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, unless otherwise confirmed by the Local Planning Authority that this is not required. The scheme shall account for any comments made by the Local Planning Authority before the development hereby permitted is first occupied.
During the course of the development: 
c. The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues. 
Before the development is first brought into use: 
d. The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clauses b) and c) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Condition : 13 - Prior to the commencement of above ground works for Studio 5, the roof extension to Studio 1 or the amenity pavilion hereby permitted, a Car Park Management Plan, to include confirmation and location of the provision for disabled spaces and electric vehicle charging points, and a review mechanism for the allocation of spaces for visitors, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and shall be put into effect when the development is first occupied.

Condition : 14 - Prior to the first occupation of each of Studio 5 and the roof extension to Studio 1 hereby permitted, evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to show that each respective phase of development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Statement, and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 15 - (A). Prior to the commencement of above ground works for Studio 5 or the roof extension to Studio 1 hereby permitted, a BREEAM Design Stage certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to show that an ?Excellent? (minimum score 70%) rating will be
5
achieved for each respective phase of development.
(B). Prior to the first occupation of each of Studio 5 and the roof extension to Studio 1 hereby permitted, a BREEAM Post-Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to show that an ?Excellent? (minimum score 70%) rating has been achieved for each respective phase of development.
Condition : 16 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, no furniture, equipment, planting or screening shall be placed on the roof terraces to Studio 1 hereby permitted.
